title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 23 february [1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 23 February [1870]
text: febuaryFebruary 23My dear walti have just got your letter and was glad to hear from you and received the papers on saturday)Saturday) dontdon't be frightendfrightened but Jeff and matty is both here matty has been here a week to daytoday Jeff had to come to pittsburghPittsburgh and stay a day or two and matt came on from there alone she is better than i expected to see her they left the children at home with her girl and davis Jeffy is going back next week as davis has got an appointment at lowelLowell and Jeff has come on but has to return before davis leaves) but matty will return by the way offof washingtonWashington sure about the 9th or 10th of marchMarch i will write particular the day before she comes george will be home on saturdaySaturday the weather has been extremely cold i am pretty well only lame as usual) walt get your new clothsclothes done if you can before matt comes she will come week after next certain) has mrs benedict a room she could accomadateaccommodate her with for a few days she will visit the masons and mrs Oconor) good bie dear waltmatty says she feels better than she did before she came from home Jeff is floureshingflourishing Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 23 February [1870]
